page.title: 10Ecology around Ripe.
page.content: The soil round Ripe is clay but there is a ridge of sandstone running West to East through Ripe. The area is made up of about 20 farms and some 100 houses. Each farm is divided into fields with hedges or fences. The hedges have grown up since Roman times and are a natural cover for wildlife. Hedges are mainly composed of Blackthorn, Whitethorn, Hornbeam, Maple, Privet, Ash, Oak and Hazel. Many other bushes are found such as Beech, Willow, Spindle, Dogwood, Wayfaring tree, Elder, Box, Bullace and Holly. Nearly all the Elm Trees have been attacked by Dutch Elm Disease. The Council has tried to stop it by chopping down afflicted trees but the stumps sprout so new saplings grow. There are some copses in the area but no woods.
